name: Micro Ninja (meteorwave)
description:
The year is 204X . . .

 Automation and robotics have changed the world.  Police have been replaced with Cop Bots.  An evil scientist named Dr Ravana has infected the Cop Bots with a computer virus. Now the bots are out of control and need to be stopped before they destroy the world!  

Join our hero Fuma Hanzo , the Micro Ninja, as he jumps, runs, and shoots his way through a challenging level.  

Controls. . .

Arrow Keys:  Movement

Space Key:  Jump

D Key:  Shoot

My First Game!

Micro Ninja needs power-ups to maintain energy throughout the level. Once you lose all your HP, you're dead

Hi I'm Meteorwave, and this is my first game ever!  I decided to participate in the LOWREZJAM to give myself a due date, and keep myself motivated to finally finish a game.  The object of this  jam was to design a game that fits into a 64 x 64 space.  

I created all my own art assets, as well as my own original music! 

I learned a ton doing this.  I'm more of an artist and a musician, but I'm currently learning programming.  I originally tried to build my game in Python but came across scaling issues that wouldn't uphold the requirements of the Jam.  So I chose GDevelop to complete my project.

There's one thing I realized, if you have a concept for a game, it's not simple enough!  I was hoping to make a five level platformer, but I was only able to make one stage before the deadline.

I ran out of time to continue to test the game,  so If you come across any bugs,  please feel free to share them with me!  I won't be offended.  I want to use this experience to learn and either continue making this game, or make a different one.

Ideas that didn't make it into the game:

  • Level checkpoints/respawn points (for now I have just placed large HP tanks frequently in the stage)
  • Player knockback while taking damage
  • Each level has an ending boss
  • In addition to the large HP power-up, I wanted a small power-up
  • Player has 3 lives.  I was only able to end the game after losing all your HP, could never figure out how to create player lives.  
  • More enemies
  • Better Enemy AI ( I'm happy I was able to make any AI, for my first game)
  • Death animation for the player 
  • Multiple themed levels
  • And more!
